1.Cons: Everything. The pay. The bosses, and the hours

2.Pros: Valued employees are compensated to stick aroundPassion for the brandFascinating time to be at a iconic brand undergoing significant changesGreat career opportunities for employees in the digital space
2.Cons: Little willingness to innovate or try new ideasOfficers manage to the interests of the executive team, not to the good of the businessLimited job security if you're not in Digital

3.Pros: Good starter job for someone inexperienced

4.Pros: I liked working there because they are very flexible with your schedule. I never had a problem with adjusting my schedule or asking for days off. I also liked working there because the tasks are not too complicated. I know this may sound crazy to others, but I really did enjoy providing good customer service. Seeing the happy faces in others made me feel happy.
4.Cons: Sometimes.....there was some crazy customers that came out of the nowhere. Sometimes when the job got really busy we were not given breaks till after several hours.

5.Pros: Good first job, gain experience in customer service
5.Cons: Can get a little hectic during rush periods

6.Pros: Good experience in a fast paced environment. Excellent setting to get your feet wet in a management setting. You can learn a lot about how a business is ran from this position
6.Cons: If servicing customers isn't a passion of yours then this job will be rather unrewarding. Ungrateful people can make the job frustrating when you are short staffed and doing everything you can.

7.Pros: Usually like the people that you work with and managers pretty friendly
7.Cons: Low wages, they toy around with the hours often so not much stability there which is nerve racking.

8.Pros: Gave consistent hours where I lived.
8.Cons: Stressful environment only because of my situation.

9.Pros: Managers were nice, could get anything I wanted off the menu, customers were alright
9.Cons: Supervisors had nasty attitudes, customers were sometimes disreapectful
